ONE OF THE MOST CRUCIAL STEPS IN
UTILIZATION OF TELEVISION IN THE
CLASSROOM , SAYS THE NARRATOR, IS
SELECTING THE PROGRAM. WHOEVER
MAKES THIS DECISION, THE SAME
SELECTION PRINCIPLES APPLY...WHETHER
THE SELECTION INVOLVES A WHOLE SERIES
OR IS MADE ON AN INDIVIDUAL LESSON
BASIS.
THE ULTIMATE BASIS FOR SELECTION IS
WHAT TELEVISION CAN DO FOR THE LEARNER.
(NARRATOR) In this teacher’s
preparation to teach with this
resource...these points are vital.
Points listed appear by special
effect over the puzzle pieces
of the teacher and the tele¬
vision receiver...as the narrator
comments on each
The lesson or lessons to be presented
by television should be selected
toward specific goals and for specific
purposes...with the nature of the
particular learning experience in
"Select for Specific Purposes" mind.
The teacher should know what these
purposes are.
